title: Bitcoin is Not for Criminals
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: We accept the good with the bad, recognizing that due to the very nature of bitcoin, we do not get to decide. There are always trade-offs, and in this case, that bitcoin will unavoidably be used for illicit purposes is the trade-off we gladly accept in exchange for the economic stability that an unmanipulable global currency will provide.

title: Bitcoin Cannot Be Banned
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Banning bitcoin is a fool’s errand. Some will try; all will fail. And the very attempts to ban bitcoin will accelerate its adoption and proliferation.

title: Bitcoin is Not a Pyramid Scheme
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: [Bitcoin] will only proliferate if it creates utility for those that adopt it.

title: Bitcoin is Not Backed by Nothing
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Ultimately, bitcoin is backed by something, and it’s the only thing that backs any money: the credibility of its monetary properties.

title: Bitcoin, Not Blockchain
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Every other fiat currency, commodity money or cryptocurrency is competing for the exact same use case as bitcoin whether it is understood or not, and monetary systems tend to a single medium because their utility is liquidity rather than consumption or production.

title: Bitcoin Fixes This
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Could the whole apparatus of central bank policy be the root cause of the problem rather than the ever-elusive solution?

title: Bitcoin is Not Too Slow
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: If a global financial system is to be built on a decentralized monetary system, the foundation must be protected at all cost.

title: Bitcoin Does Not Waste Energy
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Put a price on economic stability and the economic freedom a stable monetary system provides; that is the true justification for the amount of energy bitcoin should and will consume. Everything else is a distraction.

title: Bitcoin is Not Too Volatile
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Volatility in bitcoin is the natural function of monetary adoption and this volatility ultimately strengthens the resilience of the bitcoin network, driving long-term stability. Variation is information.

title: Bitcoin Can't Be Copied
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Those that attempt to copy bitcoin signal a failure to understand the properties that make bitcoin valuable or viable as money.

title: Gradually, Then Suddenly
author: parker-lewis
excerpt: Bitcoin exists as a solution to the money problem that is global QE.

title: Bitcoin Equals Freedom
author: ross-ulbricht
excerpt: Bitcoin was consciously, yet spontaneously taken up as money while no one was watching, and our world will never be the same.

title: The Seven Network Effects of Bitcoin
author: trace-mayer
excerpt: The […] listed network effects can only serve to strengthen [Bitcoin]. Competitors beware.

title: The Bullish Case for Bitcoin
author: vijay-boyapati
excerpt: [T]he bullish case for Bitcoin is compelling but far from obvious.

title: Bitcoin Governance
author: pierre-rochard
excerpt: Compromising on trustlessness could help the Bitcoin price find a local maximum, at the expense of finding a much higher global maximum.

title: Economics of Bitcoin as a Settlement Network
author: saifedean-ammous
excerpt: From the settlement layer view, the growing adoption of Bitcoin is increasing its liquidity internationally, allowing it to compete with global reserve currencies for increasingly more valuable transactions, causing transaction fees to rise.

title: Against the Minimum Majority Measure
author: david-a-harding
excerpt: I personally suspect that Bitcoin’s steadily improving privacy will prevent us from ever measuring decentralization in a truly objective way. Losing easy quantification but gaining stronger privacy seems like a good tradeoff to me.

title: Why the Bitcoin Dominance Index is Deceiving
author: jimmy-song
excerpt: Like with most things, Bitcoin Dominance is a very crude metric and one that’s unfortunately very easy to manipulate. The recent enthusiasm for ICOs has made the manipulation even worse and continues to hide the fact that Bitcoin is doing really well.

title: Crashes and Hyperinflation
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: This article is about how money interacts with the rest of the economy after it has matured and about how mismanagement by an issuer can cause it to fail.

title: Who Controls Ethereum?
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: If it became easier for people to trade different forks of the same currency, then investors could get direct experience with different ideas without endangering the network.

title: It's Not About the Technology, It's About the Money
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: If someone says “blockchain tech” to you, you might as well walk away right there. They’re just trying to sell you on their new decentralized crowdfunded blockchain tech internet of bitthings appscam.

title: Ethereum is Doomed
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: I fully support the attacker’s actions, and I wish I had thought of it first.

title: Proof That Proof-of-Work is the Only Solution to the Byzantine Generals' Problem
author: oleg-andreev
excerpt: If achieving consensus in a non-trust manner is ever possible in practice, then it is only possible with a Proof-of-Work scheme and highly specialized expensive production chains.

title: Who Controls Bitcoin?
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Bitcoin upgrades must be a clear improvement to Bitcoin as an investment or else they face a sharp uphill battle to adoption.

title: Bitcoin as a Store of Value, Unit of Account, and Medium of Exchange
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Bitcoin has the right properties for the world’s money, and the more the world comes to terms with this, the more stable it will become.

title: The Fappening — Brought to You By The Information Marketplace
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Bitcoin makes conspiratorial group cohesion more difficult. If the Fappening took place as I described, then this effect is right at the center. The possibility of getting bitcoins by releasing secrets caused the group to fall apart.

title: Bitcoin’s Compound Rewards
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: The difference between Bitcoin and a Ponzi scheme is that in a Ponzi scheme, the early adopters benefit by cashing out. With Bitcoin, there is no reason ever to cash out.

title: Babysitting Bitcoin Skeptics: A Response to Krugman and Gobry
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Krugman’s article and Gobry’s follow-up are confused, do not establish their case, and say nothing about Bitcoin.

title: Don’t Panic
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Working in the Bitcoin world is like working for a drug addict with bipolar disorder.

title: The Two Ideologies in Bitcoin
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: There are two ideologies in the Bitcoin world. They are not political ideologies; they are different visions of Bitcoin’s place in the world and how adoption will happen.

title: Meditations on Cypherpunk Nightmares
author: michael-goldstein
excerpt: Protecting ourselves from the dangers of crypto-anarchy requires embracing it even more fully and internalizing and practicing the virtues that have helped great men weather the storms of life since antiquity.

title: The Legacy of the Dread Pirate Roberts
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: All Bitcoin entrepreneurs today build on top of the success of the Silk Road. Their work was made possible by his.

title: Real Crypto-Anarchy Without Anonymity
author: oleg-andreev
excerpt: Bitcoin raises the cost of many kinds of attacks, going far beyond protecting against central banks meddling with money supply.

title: Bitcoin Is Great, But It Won’t Fix Our Monkey Brains
author: andrea-castillo
excerpt: Bitcoin provides us alternatives to compelled trust in monopolies but it can never obviate the need for trusted human connections. Nor can it protect us from our own pesky brain bugs’ ambiguous filters on perceived reality.

title: Everyone's a Scammer
author: michael-goldstein
excerpt: There is a war going on for your bitcoins, and willpower is your only defense.

title: Bitcoin: Killer of Nietzschean Nihilism
author: peter-dushenski
excerpt: Only Bitcoin can restore the necessary balance between the Gods. Only Bitcoin can give us life.

title: Speculative Attack
author: pierre-rochard
excerpt: Bitcoin will overtake weak currencies like the dollar through speculative attacks and currency crises, not through the careful evaluation of tech journalists and 'mainstream consumers'.

title: Bitcoin's Shroud of Subtlety and Allure
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Potential Bitcoin attackers are in a Prisoner's Dilemma. In the same way that the people cannot easily rebel against the king owing to a lack of coordination on their part, governments cannot rebel against Bitcoin for the same reason. The government puts the people in a Prisoner's Dilemma against one another, and Bitcoin does the same to government agents.

title: Bitcoin's Rugged Individualism
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: There is a fundamental agency problem with Bitcoin: agents can disappear or simulate a heist upon themselves. They cannot rationally be trusted without extreme costs being imposed on them which are more stringent than traditional banks.

title: Appcoins Are Snake Oil
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Appcoins are a terrible idea.

title: The Correct Strategy of Bitcoin Entrepreneurship
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Don't be a venture capitalist—be a speculative philanthropist.

title: Bitcoin is the Best Unit of Account
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Someone still lost in the dollar world looks at Bitcoin and sees wild and extreme volatility, whereas someone in Bitcoin looking back at the dollar sees the worst and longest economic crash in history.

title: How We Know Bitcoin Is Not a Bubble
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: The difference between money and a bubble is that a commodity whose price is a bubble actually has some underlying value.

title: How to Market Bitcoin
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Does Bitcoin need to be sanitized and separated from its anarchist, black-market roots in order to become acceptable to the general population? Absolutely not!

title: Hyperbitcoinization
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Government currencies will rapidly lose value as Bitcoin supplants it. What will such an event be like and how can it be understood economically?

title: The Coming Demise of the Altcoins (And What You Can Do to Hasten It)
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: What falleth, that shall one also push!

title: Bitcoin Has No Image Problem
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: The best way to improve Bitcoin’s image is simply to improve the Bitcoin economy.

title: I'm Hoarding Bitcoins, and No You Can't Have Any
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: The real hero is the hoarder.

title: Why Bitcoin Will Continue to Grow
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: For now at least, Bitcoin’s present trend is self-reinforcing with no equilibrium in sight.

title: I Love Bitcoin's Volatility
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Those who worry about Bitcoin’s volatility fail to understand what it actually means for Bitcoin.

title: Mastercoin is a Nightmare of Insanity
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: No one should ever use Mastercoin under any circumstances or appraise their value as anything above zero.

title: The Bitcoin Central Bank's Perfect Monetary Policy
author: pierre-rochard
excerpt: The Bitcoin Central Bank will be the longest lasting institution of its kind thanks to the anti-fragile independent monetary policy it has set in stone.

title: The Problem with Altcoins
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: In short, the altcoin phenomenon is the product of greed and bounded rationality.

title: The Original Value of Bitcoins
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Once it was known that bitcoin could be sold, even for a pittance, new possibilities opened up.

title: The Proof-of-Work Concept
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Proof-of-work should not be seen as a mysterious or wasteful system, but as something functional, natural, and potentially of value for the design of any communication protocol.

title: The Risk from the Software Industry
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Stay one step ahead of the government and don’t get embroiled in politics.

title: The Killer App of Liberty
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: If Bitcoin becomes money, the government’s control of money will have ended.

title: Public-Key Cryptography
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: Public-key cryptography is the greatest tool of liberty ever devised.

title: The Strategy
author: daniel-krawisz
excerpt: With cryptography, one libertarian inventor can create an entire libertarian society.

title: Fractional Reserve Banking is Obsolete
author: pierre-rochard
excerpt: There is no reason to deposit your money with a 3rd party. Bitcoin makes fractional reserve banking an obsolete technology.

title: End the Fed: Hoard Bitcoins
author: pierre-rochard
excerpt: Low transaction costs make Bitcoin the most competitive medium of exchange in humanity’s history, and it may be the case that a currency with even lower transaction costs is theoretically impossible.

title: Working and Saving are Revolutionary Acts
author: pierre-rochard
excerpt: New capital formation is the impetus for two trends that push the equilibrium of all industries towards decentralized markets: increasing technological sophistication and a deepening of the division of labor.
